title: Iamcrypticguy
author: Iamcrypticguy
content: A while back, I stumbled upon an article discussing a trading tournament called KCGI, which had impressive prize rewards and a well-structured format, creating quite a buzz at the time. I couldn't take part in it cos I wasn't good at trading.,But now I'm curious if anyone here participated. Has the tournament concluded, and if so, how was your experience?

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: In full meaning, it is called King's Cup Global Invitational (KCGI), sponsored by Bitget exchange.I am not a Bitget user and I was not attracted enough to join. The reason I do not join something like this is because I believe more in the money that I make from trading myself, instead of depending on what may never be mine.

comments.author: AbuBhakar
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on October 23, 2023, 10:47:28 AMIn full meaning, it is called King's Cup Global Invitational (KCGI), sponsored by Bitget exchange.I am not a Bitget user and I was not attracted enough to join. The reason I do not join something like this is because I believe more in the money that I make from trading myself, instead of depending on what may never be mine.This guy is soft shilling Bitget whenever thereâ€™s a chance in any thread here on trading discussions. He created same thread about this KCGI before https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5464563.msg62747399#msg62747399 and you can notice on his post that he keeps mentioning Bitget.Either he is an avid fan or shiller of Bitget here in the forum. This kind of tournament is not suitable for small trader because they always consider trading volume as main factor to win the tournament.
